subject: Self Care
title: The Like Economy
description: Learn The Like Economy in one minute.

hook.text: She posted a photo and checked likes every five minutes for an hour. Her self-worth was outsourced to strangers.

buildup.text: Likes trigger dopamine. Over time, self-worth becomes tied to external validation. No likes equals no value.

discovery.text: Brain scans show the same reward centers activate for social media likes as for money and food rewards.

twist.text: Platforms designed the like button to increase engagement, not to improve your mental health. It serves them, not you.

climax.text: Post and close the app. Don't check responses for 24 hours. Reclaim your self-worth from the like counter.

punchline.text: Your worth is not a like count. Stop outsourcing your value.

quiz.question: Why are social media likes so psychologically powerful?
options: They activate the same reward centers as money and food
